I hadn't seen this in a very long time, and rewatching it as an adult with some level of media literacy, it's interesting how a commentary on nuclear proliferation and collective responsibility kicked off decades of goofy monster flicks. double featuring this and Oppenheimer would be fun.

you could write ten thousand words on britain's obsession with their world war 2 legacy, since chicken run is a pretty straightforward parody of the great escape, but it does something else useful as a pure holocaust film, portraying the inevitable transition from forced labor to extermination as capitalist interests inevitably cede ground to genocide. mr. tweedy's marriage typifies this, as the family egg farm ultimately isn't enough to satisfy mrs. tweedy's greed. the occasional "chop" gives way to industrial…

this was fun in a way I don't think I was expecting. I'm not going to pretend it's super deep or anything but it's a cute exploration of the characters. good fights, good dialogue, cheesy in a good way
